layouts.name: CALM Keyboard Layout v1
layouts.description: A symbolic keyboard layout designed for expressive communication in Blesséd Dialekt. Prioritizes symbolic richness and kinetic expression while maintaining core typing functionality.
layouts.installInstructions: Download the .keylayout file for macOS, .klc for Windows, or .xkb for Linux. See repo README for detailed installation instructions per platform.

knownIssues.description: Function keys (F1-F12) are remapped to symbolic characters, which conflicts with terminal applications that rely on these keys for shortcuts and commands. Terminal emulators may not recognize the new mappings.
knownIssues.workaround: Use a separate keyboard profile for terminal work, or remap terminal shortcuts to alternative key combinations. Consider using Cmd/Ctrl+Number as alternative shortcuts.

knownIssues.description: Some Cmd+Shift combinations produce unexpected symbols due to the enhanced symbolic layer, which can interfere with application shortcuts.
knownIssues.workaround: Customize application shortcuts to avoid conflicts, or use Option key combinations instead.

knownIssues.description: Some terminal applications and older text editors may not properly render all symbolic characters, especially superscripts and mathematical symbols.
knownIssues.workaround: Use a terminal with full Unicode support (e.g., iTerm2, Windows Terminal, Alacritty). Ensure font supports extended Unicode ranges.

tradeoffs: Reduced access to traditional function keys in exchange for symbolic expressiveness
Learning curve for new symbol positions
Potential compatibility issues with legacy software
May require adjustments to existing keyboard shortcuts and muscle memory
